reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Investing Towards Impact for HIV/AIDS and RSSH in South Sudan

description.narrative: South Sudan - HIV - United Nations Development Programme - UNDP South Sudan. This program has the following goals: To reduce new HIV infections by 5% from 16,174 in 2017 to 15,360 in 2020 (Spectrum 2017). To reduce deaths among men, women and children living with HIV by 9% from 13,531 deaths in 2017 to 12,347 in 2020 (Spectrum 2017). The objectives of this program are: Increase percentage of people within key populations reporting use of a condom with their most recent partner from 10% by 2016 to 90% by end of 2021(baseline 10%-2016 MoH report). Increase percentage of adults and children living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy from current 10% to 24.8% by end of 2020 (baseline 10%-2016 MoH report). Increase percentage of pregnant women living with HIV who received antiretroviral therapy to eliminate vertical HIV transmission from 27% in 2016 to 46% by end of 2020 (2016 Program data baseline 27%.. Increase percentage of people living with HIV in care and treatment who are screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings from 70% in 2016 to 85% by end of 2020 (baseline 70%-2016 MoH report)

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for SSD-H-UNDP
Percentage of people living with HIV initiated on ART who are screened for TB in HIV treatment settings
Number of women and men aged 15+ who received an HIV test and know their results
Percentage of HIV-positive pregnant women who received antiretrovirals to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Number of people who were tested for HIV and received their results during the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery
Proportion of facility reports received over the reports expected during the reporting period
Percentage of pregnant women who know their HIV status
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Percentage of People Living with HIV on ART who had a VL test in the last 12 months
CSS-other 1: Number and Percentage of health facilities providing ART/HIV care with functional community care teams
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of HIV-positive patients who were screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings
Percentage of HIV-exposed infants receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Outcome indicator for SSD-H-UNDP
Percentage of men and women 15+ years with comprehensive and correct knowledge about HIV prevention
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Percentage of women attending antenatal care
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Percentage of women and men aged 15-49 who had more than one partner in the past 12 months who used a condom during their last sexual intercourse
Impact indicator for SSD-H-UNDP
Number of new HIV infections per 1000 uninfected population
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Percentage of young people aged 15–24 who are living with HIV
Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
